text:
Can someone point me to a current recipe for integrating with <http://packet.net|packet.net>? 
I've tried the pkt-demo which fails with `FATAL: FAILURE: exiting - 'terraform apply -target=packet_ssh_key.drp-ssh-key -auto-approve'`. A trace indicates packet returning a 401 unauthorized message so I might have the API key/Project/Username set wrong, though they look correct to me.

I've also tried creating a machine in packet with ipxe boot set to: `<http://packet.rebar.digital/default.ipxe>` which fails with:
`net0: 0c:c4:7a:b5:87:c6 using undionly on 0000:00:14.0 (open)
  [Link:up, TX:0 TXE:1 RX:0 RXE:0]
  [TXE: 1 x "Network unreachable (<http://ipxe.org/28086011>)"]
Configuring (net0 0c:c4:7a:b5:87:c6).................. ok
net0: 147.75.89.35/255.255.255.254 gw 147.75.89.34
net0: fe80::ec4:7aff:feb5:87c6/64
Next server: 147.75.200.3
Filename: <http://147.75.200.3/auto.ipxe>
<http://147.75.200.3/auto.ipxe>.... ok
auto.ipxe : 246 bytes [script]
<http://Packet.net|Packet.net> Baremetal - iPXE boot
<http://packet.rebar.digital/default.ipxe>... ok
<tftp://147.75.73.23/147.75.89.35.ipxe>.................. Connection timed out (ht
<tp://ipxe.org/4c126035>)`

<@U7P8TES5B> - I wrote the pkt-demo stuff ... and just used it on Friday successfully.  You need to make sure your API key and Project ID are correct -otherwise it will fail.   The USERNAME is used for the RackN auth to download content packs and plugin providers needed for the tooling.

I'm not sure what doc you dredged the `packet.rebar.digital` stuff from - but that is quite likely going to fail ... we are working on some other cool automated bring-up scenarios in Packet - but they aren't quite yet ready.

you can also follow the Blog that our Marketing dude <@U32PZNCP5> wrote - on using the pkt-demo stuff, at:
<https://www.rackn.com/2018/03/14/deploy-and-test-digital-rebar-provision-in-less-than-10-minutes-how-to-guide/>

attachments.title: Deploy and Test Digital Rebar Provision in less than 10 Minutes : How To Guide - RackN
attachments.text: Part 1 of 3 in Digital Rebar Provision How To Blog Series (Part 2) RackN Portal Management Connection to the 10 Minute Demo  (Part 3) Create your first CentOS 7 Machine on RackN Portal with Digital Rebar Provision  For operators...
attachments.fallback: RackN: Deploy and Test Digital Rebar Provision in less than 10 Minutes : How To Guide - RackN

text:
<@U6QFVRJNB> - Just to be sure, the packet API key is something one adds to the project and the Project ID is part of the general info for the project?
And the USERNAME  - is that the Account ID found by clicking on the leftmost blue tab button?

As for where I got packet.rebar.digital that's available on the Packet site at <https://www.packet.net/developers/guides/ditch-cobbler-for-rackn/>

attachments.title: Ditch Cobbler for RackN
attachments.text: Booting up bare metal servers no longer has to be hard and finicky! Ditch Cobbler and try out RackN on Packet's bare metal servers. In no time at all you can test out the custom IPXE boot using the Packet Rebar endpoint that RackN has enabled for quick starts.

text: <@U7P8TES5B> yes, that's a pretty old post - back in the v3.2 era.  Start from <http://rebar.digital> or this video library: <https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLXPBeIrpXjfilUi7Qj1Sl0UhjxNRSC7nx>
<@U7P8TES5B> - info on Packet keys and ids:  <https://help.packet.net/quick-start/api-integrations>

attachments.title: API & Integrations
attachments.text: A quick guide to Packet's powerful API, as well as common DevOps tools and integrations.
